Name: Amaranth
sowInstructions: Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 64°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 7-8 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Onions  corn  peppers  egg plant  tomatoes
culinaryHints: Both leaves and seeds can be used. Excessive intake is not recommended.

Name: Beans - dwarf
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 61°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 7-10 weeks. Pick often to encourage more flower production.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Sweetcorn  spinach  lettuce  summer savory  dill  carrots  brassicas  beets  radish  strawberry and cucumbers  tagates minuta (wild marigold)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Alliums (Chives  leek  garlic  onions) Sunflower
culinaryHints: Can be used in salads when young  blanched and cooled.

Name: Sweet corn
sowInstructions: Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 61°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 11-14 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): All beans  cucumber  melons  peas  pumpkin  squash  amaranth
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Celery.
culinaryHints: Piick and cook within an hour. Remove the silks and outer leaves. Best flavour if microwave about 4 minutes per cob. Can be barbequed wrapped in foil. Cook large amounts in a stock pot until test soft. Sprinkle with black pepper and dip in butter.

Name: Cowpeas
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. When soil begins to warm up. After frosts finish.. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 59°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 11-14 weeks.
culinaryHints: Young leaves can be cooked and used like spinach and are very high in protein. The young pods are edible.

Name: Corn Salad
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 5-8 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Onions
culinaryHints: Pick individual leaves or harvest the whole plant as required

Name: Chives
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 7-11 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Carrots  Tomatoes  Parsley  Apples
culinaryHints: Use raw in salads or as a mild onion flavour in cooked dishes.

Name: Coriander
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 30-45 days.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dill  Chervil  Anise  Cabbages  Carrots
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Fennel
culinaryHints: Use the leaves to flavour hot meals or add fresh to salads.
culinaryPreservation: The seeds can be dried and ground up for curries.

Name: Collards
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-11 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dwarf (bush) beans  beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  chamomile)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chili  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry  mustard
culinaryHints: Slice and steam or use in stir-fry

Name: Choko/Chayote
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Plant whole mature fruit when one produces a shoot at one end.. Best planted at soil temperatures between 59°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 17 weeks. Best when fruit is light green and not more than 6cm long.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Cucumbers
culinaryHints: Chokos can be peeled and chopped to use in stews  soup or as a stir fry vegetable. Cooked or raw  it has a very mild flavour and is commonly served with seasonings e.g.  salt  butter and pepper or in a dish with other vegetables and/or flavourings. It canbe boiled  stuffed  mashed or pickled

Name: Burdock
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 17-18 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best grown in separate bed.
culinaryHints: Harvest in the first year when the burdock root is very crisp and has a sweet  mild  and pungent flavour with a little muddy harshness that can be reduced by soaking julienne/shredded roots in water for five to ten minutes. Immature flower stalks maybe harvested in late spring  before flowers appear; the taste resembles that of artichoke  to which the burdock is related. It is a key ingredient in the traditional Dandelion and Burdock beer.

Name: Chinese cabbage
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow direct in the garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-10 weeks. Harvest whole head or you can take a few leaves at a time.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dwarf (bush) beans  beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  chamomile  coriander)  lettuce  potatoes
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chilli  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry  mustard
culinaryHints: Use in stir-fry . Has a milder flavour than regular cabbage.Shred the inner leaves and stems to use in coleslaw salad.

Name: Chilli peppers
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 64°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 9-11 weeks. Wear gloves to pick 'hot' chilies.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best grown in a separate bed as chillis need plenty of light and air circulation.
culinaryHints: Wash  dry  and free whole. Use them direct from the freezer (no need to defrost). Wear plastic gloves or wash your hands thoroughly after handling and cutting to avoid accidentally rubbing chilli juice onto your mouth or eyes!

Name: Cabbage
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 41°F and 64°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 11-15 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dwarf (bush) beans  beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  chamomile  thyme)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chili  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry  mustard  parsnip
culinaryHints: Young spring cabbage can be chopped and added to salad greens. Steaming preserves the goodness and flavour of cabbage. Canbe used in stir-fry. Red cabbage chopped and cooked with brown sugar  red wine  onions  vinegar and stock is served with boiled bacon or pork.

Name: Celery
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 54°F and 70°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 17-18 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Not applicable as celery needs to be close together to encourage blanching.
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Sweetcorn
culinaryHints: Chop and use raw in salad or braised in hot dishes.

Name: Chicory
sowInstructions: Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 16-24 weeks. Will need forcing before final harvest.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Carrots  onions  Florence fennel  tomatoes.
culinaryHints: Good in salads. Grill lightly with butter. Bake with ham and cheese.

Name: Cauliflower
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 15-22 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dwarf (bush) beans  beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  chamomile)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chili  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry  mustard
culinaryHints: Cauliflower can be steamed. Young ones can be broken into small pieces and added raw to salad. Cook briefly and add to curry mix. Traditionally served with cheese sauce. Add tomato slices for colour.

Name: Celeriac
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 70°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 14-28 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Beans  brassicas  carrots  leeks  lettuce  peas  sage  tomatoes  onions
culinaryHints: Cook whole  scrubbed and peeled. Or slice or dice.Tastes like celery.

Name: Cape Gooseberry
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 14-16 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Will happily grow in a flower border
culinaryHints: The berry is the size of a cherry tomato  is very aromatic and full of tiny seeds. They are delicious eaten fresh or can be made into jam. They can be added to salads  desserts and cooked dishes  they are delicious stewed with other fruit  especially apples. Theygo well in savoury dishes with meat or seafood.

Name: Cardoon
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 55°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 34-35 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best grown in separate bed.
culinaryHints: Cut off the base and leaves  then cut the stalks into pieces. Boil the stalks for around 20 minutes until tender: drain  and peel off the surface of the stalks. Add precooked cardoons to a variety of dishes  they go well with mushrooms.

Name: Carrot
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 12-18 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Onions  Leeks  Lettuce  Sage  Peas  Radishes  Tomatoes  Beans  Celery  Rosemary
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Parsnips  Beetroot  Dill  Brassicas  Fennel
culinaryHints: Steamed or raw carrots are tasty. Cook them in a small amount of water until nearly dry then add a pat of butter and teasp of brown sugar to glaze. They can be added to most casserole-type dishes. Grate raw carrots and add to salads

Name: Capsicum
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 64°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 10-12 weeks. Cut fruit off with sharp knife.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Egg plant (Aubergine)  Nasturtiums  Basil  Parsley  Amaranth
culinaryHints: Can be sliced and seeded and used raw in salads. Or brush with olive oil  roast at a high temperature until the skin changes colour then put in a covered dish until cool and rub off the skin and remove seeds.
culinaryPreservation: Will freeze successfully without blanching if seeded and sliced.

Name: Angelica
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 18 months. Angelica archangelica has slightly dull leaves  not shiny..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Any herbs that like damp  shady areas - mint  lemon balm
culinaryHints: The stems can be candied and used to decorate cakes and pastries. Pick the stems in the second year.

Name: Artichokes (Globe)
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 59°F and 64°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 42-57 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Needs a lot of space. Best in separate bed
culinaryHints: Pick buds before scales develop brown tips. If you have lots of small buds  they can be fried in olive oil and eaten whole. Rinse in plenty of cold water to remove earwigs or other insects.

Name: Cucumber
sowInstructions: Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 61°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-10 weeks. Cut fruit off with scissors or sharp knife.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Nasturtiums  Beans  Celery  Lettuce  Sweet Corn  Cabbages  Sunflowers  Coriander  Fennel  Dill  Sunflowers
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potato  Tomatoes
culinaryHints: Pick frequently before the fruit become too big. Use raw in salads  peeled if preferred.

Name: Asparagus
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Plant as crowns. Best planted at soil temperatures between 61°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 2-3 years. Plant 'crowns' to harvest earlier .
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Parsley  Basil  Nasturtiums  Lettuce
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Garlic  Onions  and root vegetables
culinaryHints: Steaming is traditional  then coating with melted butter or hollandaise sauce. Alternatively break in short lengths  and cook quickly in hot oil in a wok and sprinkle with soy sauce or balsamic vinegar. NOTE: The asparagus berries are poisonous. Only the young shoots are edible.

Name: Asparagus Pea Winged bean
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 59°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-11 weeks. Pick early  pick often.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best grown in separate bed
culinaryHints: Cook quickly by steaming and serve with just a touch of butter and they are said to taste like their namesake .

Name: Basil
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 64°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 10-12 weeks. Pick before flowering.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Tomato
culinaryHints: Basil is commonly used fresh in cooked recipes. It is generally added at the last moment  as cooking quickly destroys the flavour. Tear rather than chop. The fresh herb can be kept for a short time in plastic bags in the refrigerator  or for a longer period in the freezer  after being blanched quickly in boiling water.

Name: Beans - broad beans  fava beans Fava bean
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 43°F and 75°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 12-22 weeks. Pick frequently to encourage more pods.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dill  Potatoes
culinaryHints: "The fresh beans are eaten steamed or boiled. As the beans mature it is better to remove their tough outer skins after cooking. The leafy top shoots of the adult plants can be picked and steamed after flowering. Small beans can be eaten whole in the pods.

also: Will freeze well. Remove from pods and blanch.
sowInstructions: http://gardenate.com/image/158/thumb/150/150; http://gardenate.com/image/93/thumb/150/150; http://gardenate.com/image/159/thumb/150/150; http://gardenate.com/image/92/thumb/150/150

Name: Beans - climbing Pole beans  Runner beans  Scarlet Runners
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 61°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 9-11 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Sweetcorn  spinach  lettuce  summer savory  dill  carrots  brassicas  beets  radish  strawberry  cucumbers  zucchini  tagates minuta (wild marigold)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Alliums (Chives  leek  garlic  onions)  Florence fennel
culinaryHints: Use young in salads - blanch and cool.

Name: Beetroot
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 45°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 7-10 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Onions  Silverbeet (Swiss Chard)  Lettuce  Cabbage  Dwarf Beans  Dill  Peas. Strawberries
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Asparagus  Carrots  Sweetcorn  Spinach
culinaryHints: Apart from boiling whole for salads  beetroot roast well  cut in wedges. Theymake a tasty salad grated raw with carrot and a little fresh orange juice.

Name: Borage
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-10 weeks. Use leaves before flowers appear  otherwise they will be 'hairy'. .
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Strawberry  tomatoes  zucchini/squash. Deters pests from many plants.
culinaryHints: Has a slight cucumber taste which goes well in salads and when cooked with silver beet or cabbage. The flowers make a pretty drink decoration when frozen in an iceblock.

Name: Broccoli
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 45°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 10-16 weeks. Cut flowerhead off with a knife..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dwarf (bush) beans  beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  chamomile  oregano)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chilli  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry  mustard
culinaryHints: The stem (peeled)  leaves  and flowerhead are all edible. Steam for best flavour. Peel large stalks  slice and steam. Goes well with blue cheese sauce.

Name: Brussels sprouts
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 45°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 14-28 weeks. Pick sprouts when small. .
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dwarf (bush) beans  beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  chamomile)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chili  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry  mustard
culinaryHints: Remove any discoloured outer leaves. Cut in half and steam with other vegetables. Do not overcook as that produces the distinctive smell that puts people off eating Brussels sprouts! They go well with a chopped tomato and onion mix.Traditionally served with roasted chestnuts for Xmas dinner in UK.

Name: Pumpkin
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 68°F and 90°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 15-20 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Sweet Corn
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Cut up  remove the skin and roast with other vegetables or meat. Young crisp shoots with young leaves can be cooked and eaten - stewed in coconut milk they are popular in Melanesia. Remove any strings and tough parts and stew until tender  or cook as a vegetable in boiling water 3-5 minutes.

Name: Potato
sowInstructions: Plant tuber. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 15-20 weeks. Dig carefully  avoid damaging the potatoes.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Peas  Beans  Brassicas  Sweetcorn  Broad Beans  Nasturtiums  Marigolds
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Cucumber  Pumpkin  Sunflowers  Tomatoes  Rosemary
culinaryHints: Peeled or unpeeled and scrubbed  potatoes can be boiled  baked  fried and roasted. - The only way they are not used is raw. Keep in a pot of cold water after peeling  otherwise they will discolour.

Name: Peas
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 8°C and 24°C. (Show °F/in)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 9-11 weeks. Pick the pods every day to increase production.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Potatoes
culinaryHints: Raw straight from the pod in the garden is best! Raw in salads. Steamed lightly. Small pods can be steamed whole.

Name: Parsnip
sowInstructions: Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 43°F and 70°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 17-20 weeks. Best flavour if harvested after a frost..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Swiss Chard (Silverbeet)  Capsicum  Peas  Potatoes  Beans  Radishes  Garlic
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Carrot  Celery  Brassicas
culinaryHints: Peel and roast with vegetables or meat. The sweetish flavour of parsnips enhances most other vegetables.

Name: Parsley
also: curly leaf parsley or flat leaf (Italian) parsley
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 9-19 weeks. Cut stalks from outer part of plant.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Carrots  Chives  Tomatoes  Asparagus
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Use the leaves and stems to add flavour and colour. Can be cooked in dishes such as ratatouille  Traditionally used in white sauce.

Name: Pak Choy
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 70°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 6-11 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dwarf (bush) beans  beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  chamomile  coriander)  lettuce  potatoes
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chili  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry  mustard
culinaryHints: "You can treat Pak Choy as ""cut and come again "" or use the whole plant in one go  whichever suits your needs."

Name: Oregano
sowInstructions: Sow in garden  or start in seed trays. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 64°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 6-8 weeks. When flowers appear.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Broccoli
culinaryHints: Used to flavour tomato dishes  soups  sauces and Greek dishes like moussaka

Name: Onion
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 25-34 weeks. Allow onions to dry before storing.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Lemon Balm  Borage  Carrots  Beets  Silverbeet  Lettuce  Amaranth
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Peas  Beans
culinaryHints: Brown onions roasted whole with other vegetables are delicious. Red onions add colour to salads or stir-fry.

Name: Okra
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 68°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 11-14 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Peppers (Capsicum  Chili)  Eggplant (Aubergine)
culinaryHints: Use pods fresh or dried in soups or casseroles or as a boiled vegetable.

Name: NZ Spinach
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 64°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-10 weeks. Pick the tips.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Does better if alone.
culinaryHints: Can be used as a substitute for real spinach in cooking. Pick the growing tips at about 8-10cm (4-6 in). To remove oxalates it's a good idea to blanch the leaves for 3 minutes or so  then rinse the leaves in cold water before using them in salads or for cooking.(ABC TV)

Name: Mustard greens
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 5-8 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dwarf (bush) beans  beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  camomile)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chilli  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry
culinaryHints: Use young leaves in salad for a 'spicy kick'. Add to stir fry.

Name: Mizuna
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 35-50 days.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Radish  lettuce
culinaryHints: Leaves used raw  stir-fried  in soups. Young flowering stems can be cooked like broccoli.

Name: Mint
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Grow in trays and plant out or start from cuttings. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 70°F and 75°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-12 weeks. Cut leaves from top with scissors.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Cabbages  Tomatoes
culinaryHints: Mint adds a fresh flavour if chopped and sprinkled over salads. And is traditionally used mixed with vinegar and sugar to make mint sauce for lamb.

Name: Marrow
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 68°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 12-17 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Peas  Beans  Onions  Sweetcorn
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Good  cut in thick slices  seeds removed and stuffed with mince or spicy vegetable mix then baked in the oven

Name: Luffa
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 68°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 11-12 weeks. Use as a back scratcher.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Peas  Beans  Onions  Sweetcorn
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: The luffa flowers and fruits are soft and edible when young and are sometimes cooked and eaten like squash or okra. Loofah has been an important food source in many Asian cultures. The leaves and vines should not be eaten.

Name: Lettuce
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden  or start in seed trays and plant out in 4-6 weeks.. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 8°C and 27°C. (Show °F/in)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-12 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Carrots  Onions  Strawberries  Beets  Brassicas  Radish  Marigold  Borage  Chervil  Florence fennel  leeks.
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Parsley  Celery
culinaryHints: Wash well  spin or shake dry and use in salads and sandwiches

Name: Lemon Balm
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-10 weeks. Cut back tall stems to prevent flowering.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Good to attract bees
culinaryHints: As a herb tea or added to fruit punch. Can be used to replace lemon  used sparingly  in desserts and with stewed fruit. Chop leaves into salad. Better used fresh than dried.

Name: Kale Borecole
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 7-9 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dwarf (bush) beans  beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  camomile)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chilli  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry  mustard
culinaryHints: Strong flavoured and nutritious vegetable. Wash well and chop finely then steam. A tomato or cheese sauce will mask the flavour if too strong.

Name: Kohlrabi
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 7-10 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Beets  celery  cucumber  onions  marigold  nasturtium  rhubarb  aromatic herbs (sage  dill  chamomile)
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Climbing (pole) beans  tomato  peppers (chilli  capsicum)  eggplant (aubergine)  strawberry  mustard
culinaryHints: Use when young. Scrub well  cut off leaf stalks  roots and woody parts. Young ones do not need peeling. Can be grated raw for salads or cut in pieces and steam. Use in casseroles.

Name: Leeks
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 15-18 weeks. Loosen with a fork rather than pull by hand..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Carrots
culinaryHints: Trim off the roots and any damaged leaves. Young ones can be used whole with some of the green leaves. Wash thoroughly as the earth tends to get inside. Chop and fry in butter (or olive oil) until tender. Can be added to casserole meals  allowing time to cook through. Leek and mushroom make a tasty combination for a tart filling.

Name: Jerusalem Artichokes
sowInstructions: "Easy to grow. Plant tubers about 5cm (1.5"") deep.. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 59°F. (Show °C/cm)"
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 15-20 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Tomatoes  cucumbers
culinaryHints: Scrape clean or peel (add a tsp of lemon or vinegar to the water to stop the tubers browning). Steam  boil  or use in artichoke soup (make with artichokes and some stock). Caution - because they contain 'resistent starch' Jerusalem Artichokes are a great promoter of flatulence in some individuals.

Name: Daikon
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Direct in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-10 weeks. Dig daikon carefully. They are rather brittle..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Chervil  cress lettuce  leeks  spinach  strawberries  tomatoes
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Gherkins  hyssop
culinaryHints: Daikon radish can be eaten simmered  stir fried  grated  pickled or baked. Its leaves areedible and can be used in recipes that call for turnip greens  and its seeds make sprouts to eat in salads or in sandwiches.

Name: Dill
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-12 weeks. Use leaves before flowering.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Cabbage  Coriander  Fennel  tomatoes  broccoli
culinaryHints: Dill leaves can be used fresh or dried in salads  meats  vegetable dishes and soups. Freshly cut leaves enhance the flavour of dips  herb butter  soups  salads  fish dishes  and salads. Both the flowering heads and seeds are used in flavoured vinegars and oils. Used whole or ground  the seeds add zest to bread  cheese  and salad dressing.

Name: Eggplant
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 75°F and 90°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 12-15 weeks. Cut fruit with scissors or sharp knife.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Beans  capsicum  lettuce  amaranth  thyme
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Cut and use the same day if possible. Slice  no need to peel  and fry in olive oil.  Brush with oil and grill or bake. Or microwave plain  for about 4 minutes on high. Makes a good substitute for pasta in lasagne or moussaka. Can be smoked over a gas ring or barbecue  cooled and peeled and used to make dips.

Name: Endive
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 59°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 10-11 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): beans  brassicas  carrots  cucumbers  chervil  sage.
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Alliums (garlic and onions)
culinaryHints: Very tasty topped with grated swiss cheese and grilled for a couple of minutes to crisp up the cheese and wilt the leaves. Can use in salads additional to lettuce  but needs a flavoursome dressing if you aren't overly fond of bitterness.

Name: Fennel
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 14-15 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best grown away from vegetables
culinaryHints: Cut off leaves as required Use leaves fresh or dried . Particularly good with fish. The seeds can be used in pickling mixes.

Name: French tarragon
sowInstructions: Plant cuttings or root division. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 30-40 days. Pick leaves when young for best flavour.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Aubergine (Eggplant) and Capsicum (Peppers)
culinaryHints: Tarragon goes well with fish  pork  beef  poultry  game  potatoes  tomatoes  carrots  and most vegetables.Â Tarragon can be used in cream sauces  herbed butters and vinegars  soups  sour creams  and yogurt. However  it can be overpowering in large amounts.

Name: Garlic
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Plant cloves. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 17-25 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Beets  Carrots  Cucumbers  Dill  Tomatoes  Parsnips
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Asparagus  Beans  Brassicas  Peas  Potatoes
culinaryHints: Cut the growing shoots or use the entire young garlic plants as 'garlic greens' in stirfry.

Name: Ginger
sowInstructions: Plant pieces of fresh root showing signs of shoots. Best planted at soil temperatures between 20°C and 30°C. (Show °F/in)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 25 weeks. Reduce water as plant dies back to encourage rhizome growth.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Grow in separate bed
culinaryHints: "Use in any recipes requiring fresh ginger. Widely used in Asian cooking  it is hot without the 'burn' of chilli.

also: Ginger root freezes well either whole or grated  and can be used direct from the freezer in most recipes requiring fresh ginger.
sowInstructions: http://gardenate.com/image/74/thumb/150/150; http://gardenate.com/image/154/thumb/150/150

Name: Horseradish
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Plant root pieces. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 16-24 weeks. Some improvement in flavour if left till after frost..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best kept separate
culinaryHints: Strong  spicy flavour traditionally used with roast beef. Used grated for horseradish sauce or horseradish cream

Name: Zucchini
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 70°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 6-9 weeks. Cut the fruit often to keep producing.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Corn  beans  nasturtiums  parsley  Silverbeet  Tomatoes
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Zucchini are best picked or cut off the stem at about 15cm / 6 inches.Pick frequently to keep the plant producing new flowers.

Name: Yam/Oka
sowInstructions: "Plant tubers about 5cm (1.5"") deep covered with soil. Best planted at soil temperatures between 63°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)"
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 15-20 weeks. Leave in the ground until foliage has completely died down so tubers reach maximum size.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best in separate bed
culinaryHints: Scrub and boil or roast with other vegetables.

Name: Yacon
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Plant sprouting root/tuber to a depth of about 4cm and mulch to cover. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 25 weeks. You can collect a few at a time without digging out the whole plant..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best in separate bed
culinaryHints: The large roots can be used raw in salads peel and chop. Sprinkle with lemon juice to prevent browning. 'In the Andes  they are grated and squeezed through a cloth to yield a sweet refreshing drink. The juice canbe boiled down to produce a syrup. In South America the juice is concentrated to form dark brown blocks of sugar called chancaca.' (Green Harvest)

Name: Watermelon
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 70°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 12-17 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Sweetcorn  Sunflowers
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Cut up and eat in slices. Use to make fruit drinks. Use in fruit salads.

Name: Turnip
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 12°C and 30°C. (Show °F/in)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 6-9 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Peas  Beans  Chives  Spinach  Carrots  Chicory
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes  Tomatoes
culinaryHints: Grate young turnips and use raw in salads. Use older turnips in casseroles and stews.

Name: Tomato
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 61°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-17 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Asparagus  Chervil Carrot  Celery  Chives  Parsley  Marigold  Basil
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Rosemary  Potatoes  Fennel
culinaryHints: Use in sauces  with fried meals  in sandwiches.
culinaryPreservation: Can be frozen whole or in pieces.

Name: Tomatillo
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 70°F and 81°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 10-14 weeks. Husk splits when fruit is ripe..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Will happily grow in a flower border
culinaryHints: Use in spicy sauces with or to replace tomatoes. They are the base of salsa verde in Mexican cookery.

Name: Thyme
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays and plant out 6-8 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 59°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 42-52 weeks. Root divisions ready in 3 months.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Dry-environment herbs (oregano sage)  Eggplant  Cabbage
culinaryHints: Common  lemon  orange and caraway thyme are used in cooking. Thyme is mainly used with meat and fish buttastes good with vegetables such as mushrooms  beans and carrots. The flavour can be very intense so thyme is best used sparingly.

Name: Taro
sowInstructions: Plant small pieces of tuber or suckers  5-8cm deep. Best planted at soil temperatures between 68°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 28 weeks. When the leaves begin to die down. .
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best in separate bed
culinaryHints: Taro can be cooked like potatoes  boiled  roasted  fried or steamed. It is not eaten raw.

Name: Sweet Potato
sowInstructions: Plant shoots or cuttings (Slips). Best planted at soil temperatures between 63°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 15-17 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Best in Separate bed
culinaryHints: Use mashed  boiled  roasted  baked or fried. Or use in soups  pies  casseroles  curries and salads.

Name: Sweet Marjoram
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-10 weeks. Best flavour if picked before flowering.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Peppers (Capsicums  Chilis)  Sage
culinaryHints: Sweet Marjoram has a mild oregano flavor with a hint of balsam. Sweet Marjoram can be used as a substitute for oregano in sauces for mediterranean style pizza  lasagna  and eggplant parmigiana.

Name: Sunflower
sowInstructions: Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 10-11 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Cucumbers  Melons  Sweetcorn  Squash
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Use seeds fresh or toasted

Name: Strawberry
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Plant with crown (of roots) just covered.. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 11 weeks. Strawberries bruise easily when ripe  handle carefully. Pick with a small piece of stem attached..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Better in a bed on their own to allow good sun and air circulation
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: If you are using rotation beds  avoid putting strawberries where you have grown tomatoes  potatoes  peppers or eggplant
culinaryHints: Pick strawberries and eat them straight from the garden - warm from the sunshine  delicious! Strawberries can be used in any dessert needing soft fruit or berries. Summer pudding whichhas raspberries and blackberries or boysenberries  mousse  trifle  dipped in melted chocolate or just with cream. Sprinkle a bowl of strawberries with balsamic vinegar and a little sugar to enhance the flavour and colour.

Name: Strawberries (from seeds)
sowInstructions: Start inside in pots or trays after chilling seeds.. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 1 years. Seedlings need to grow for about a year before fruiting. Remove first flowers. .
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Better in a bed on their own to allow good sun and air circulation
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: If you are using rotation beds  avoid putting strawberries where you have grown tomatoes  potatoes  peppers or eggplant
culinaryHints: Strawberries can be used in any dessert needing soft fruit or berries. Summer pudding with raspberries and blackberries or boysenberries  mousse  trifle  dipped in melted chocolate or just with cream. Sprinkle a bowl of strawberries with balsamic vinegar and a little sugar to enhance the flavour and colour.Straight from the garden  warmed by the sun is best.

Name: Squash
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 70°F and 95°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 7-8 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Sweet corn
culinaryHints: Use whole or sliced. Steam or fry.

Name: Spring onions
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 8-12 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Lemon Balm  Borage  Carrots  Beets  Silverbeet  Lettuce  Amaranth
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Peas  Beans
culinaryHints: Can be eaten raw in salads. Often used chopped and sprinkled on Asian stir-fry.

Name: Spinach
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 5-11 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Broad beans (fava)  cabbage  cauliflower  celery  eggplant (aubergine)  onion  peas  strawberry  santolina
culinaryHints: Use young leaves in salad. Steam and add to other vegetables.

Name: Snow Peas
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 12-14 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Carrots  Endive  Florence fennel  Winter lettuce  Brassicas.
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Chives  Alliums  Tomatoes
culinaryHints: Cook whole or eat raw in salads

Name: Silverbeet
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 7-12 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Beans  brassica sp. (cabbage  cauliflower  etc)  tomato  allium sp. (onion  garlic  chives)  lavender  parsnip
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Corn  melon  cucurbit (cucumbers  squash  melons  gourds)  most herbs  potato.
culinaryHints: Wash thoroughly and inspect the back of the leaves for insects. Chop and put in a saucepan with very little water ( or just what is on the leaves). Cover and cook over a low to medium heat until the leaves collapse. A small amount of nutmeg enhances the flavour.

Name: Shallots
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Plant small bulblets  with stem just showing above ground. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 12-15 weeks. Keep a few for your next planting.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Lemon Balm  Borage  Carrots  Beets  Silverbeet  Lettuce  Amaranth
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Peas  Beans
culinaryHints: Use in any recipe instead of onions. Can be cooked whole  braised gently with other vegetables.

Name: Savory - winter savory
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Start in trays. Cover seed lightly.. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 64°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 6-10 weeks. Use the leaves fresh..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Beans
culinaryHints: Can be used as seasoning for beans and other green vegetables.

Name: Savory - summer savory
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in Garden. Lightly cover.. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 64°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 6-10 weeks. Cut before flowers form for best flavour.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Beans  Onions
culinaryHints: Usually added to peas  beans or lentils. It has a slightly spicy flavour.

Name: Radish
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 46°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 5-7 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Chervil  cress lettuce  leeks  spinach  strawberries  tomatoes
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Hyssop  gherkins
culinaryHints: Wash well and remove leaves and roots. Use raw in salads or on their own with bread and butter.

Name: Rhubarb
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Plant pieces of rhizome or roots 8 - 10 cm (3 - 4 in.) deep. Best planted at soil temperatures between 41°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 1 years. You will have a stronger plant if you leave it for about a year before using..
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Brassicas (Cabbage  Broccoli  Cauliflower  etc)
culinaryHints: Pick stems about the thickness of your finger. Large stems will have tough 'strings' down the length of them. Use in pies  crumbles  fools and jams. Rhubarb goes well with orange. Will usually need sweetener.

Name: Rocket
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 21-35 days.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Lettuce
culinaryHints: Use in salads and stir-fry

Name: Rockmelon
sowInstructions: Grow in seed trays  and plant out in 4-6 weeks. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 68°F and 90°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 10-16 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Sweetcorn  Sunflowers
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Cut in half and scoop out and discard the seeds. Sprinkle with some ground ginger or serve plain.

Name: Rosella
sowInstructions: Sow in garden  or start in seed trays. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 20°C and 35°C. (Show °F/in)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 21-25 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Feverfew  Coriander  Nasturtium and Hyssop
culinaryHints: The large flowers produce a crimson enlarged calyx. Use the fleshy red calyx  without the green seed pod to make jam or jelly.

Name: Rosemary
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Plant cuttings . Best planted at soil temperatures between 59°F and 68°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 1 years. In warmer areas  harvest time might be shorter.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Beans  Carrots  Cabbages  Sage
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Leaves sprinkled on roast potatoes  meat and barbeque food make them extra tasty. Rosemary canbe used to add flavour to vinegars and oils.

Name: Rutabaga
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 45°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 10-14 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Peas  Beans  Chives
avoidInstructions: Avoid growing close to: Potatoes
culinaryHints: Use when about the size of a tennis ball. The leaves can be cooked like cabbage when young.

Name: Salsify
sowInstructions: Easy to grow. Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 86°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in 14-21 weeks.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Beans  Brassicas  Carrots  Celeriac  Endive  Kohl-rabi  Leeks  Lettuce  Alliums  Spinach
culinaryHints: Wash and scrape the roots then boil before frying or roasting. They canbe used to make a creamed soup.

Name: Sage
sowInstructions: Sow in garden. Sow seed at a depth approximately three times the diameter of the seed. Best planted at soil temperatures between 50°F and 77°F. (Show °C/cm)
harvestInstructions: Harvest in approximately 18 months. Time reduced if grown from cuttings.
compatiblePlants: Compatible with (can grow beside): Broccoli  Cauliflower  Rosemary  Cabbage and Carrots
culinaryHints: The leaves are used to flavour stuffing and meat dishes. Sage keeps well if dried.
